messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/28/2003 1:44:07 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... LOL My 4-yo daughter reported to me that her 5-yo cousin gave her a kiss at Christmas and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/28/2003 1:44:07 PM Eastern Standard Time,
syltoyama@... writes:

> It's good to know my sons aren't the only ones falling in love with a
> cousin!

LOL My 4-yo daughter reported to me that her 5-yo cousin gave her a kiss at
Christmas and told her that she shouldn't tell anybody! I remember having a
crush on my cousin as a kid, too.
Amy Kagey
Usborne Books make great holiday gifts!
my Usborne Books website!

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Little Romeos ~was~ Be Proud of Me
messages.msgSnippet: It s good to know my sons aren t the only ones falling in love with a cousin!  My oldest son had a huge crush on my youngest cousin (they are only 2mos apart
messages.messageBody:
It's good to know my sons aren't the only ones falling in love with a cousin! My oldest son had a huge crush on my youngest cousin (they are only 2mos apart in age) until about age 8 or so. It did pass. We let Andy have his little fantasy for now, knowing he'll outgrow it and that raining on his parade now would break his heart. He's had other crushes, and recently a friend confided to me that her 7yo daughter has a crush on Andy. We seem to have entered the boy/girl years already.

Just yesterday, Andy told me he really likes an older girl we know, but says he's afraid to tell her. Knowing who she is, it's really sweet.

Syl






---------------------------------
Do you Yahoo!?
Yahoo! Photos - Get your photo on the big screen in Times Square

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Little Romeos ~was~ Be Proud of Me
messages.msgSnippet: ... Sounds like my grandson. Kaelin is always talking about pretty girls and pretty ladies. He likes to watch the pretty lady movie . (Sound of Music) And
messages.messageBody:
>
>
>This made me laugh. This is my 7 year old. Ever
>since he was a toddler he has been a girl chaser,
>literally. He used to chase cute little girls in the
>mall or other public places when he was a year or
>less. Precocious in more than just walking
>apparently! All his best friends, aside from his
>brother, have been girls. He is also in love with a
>same age cousin, child of my brother. I haven't the
>heart to shatter all his inctricate plans by telling
>him first cousins don't generally marry. LOL

Sounds like my grandson. Kaelin is always talking about pretty girls and
pretty ladies. He likes to watch the "pretty lady movie". (Sound of Music)
And he's started trying to hug or kiss any little girl he sees.
He's crazy about "little girl" stuff. He loves his dollhouse and asked for
one of the Groovy Girl mermaids for Christmas. He also loves the castle he
got and his "brave knights".
He loves his Bob the Builder clothes and says, "Me big boy!". But he also
loves to wear his sister's old tutu. For our Christmas Eve celebration, he
was asked what he wanted to wear. "My white one." He meant the fancy white
dress his sister has grown out of. With his very long, wavy blonde hair . .
. he looked so cute. If anyone remembers the Christmas issue of Woman's Day
(I think that was the one) with the little blonde girl peeking out from
behind the Christmas tree, that could have been Kaelin except he's a little
older and his hair is longer. Later in the evening he opened a present with
a T shirt that had a muscle car on it. The dress came off and on went the T
shirt.
LOL!
He's *very* clear, though, about, "Me big boy!"
Tia

messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] Little Romeos ~was~ Be Proud of Me
messages.msgSnippet: ... This made me laugh.  This is my 7 year old.  Ever since he was a toddler he has been a girl chaser, literally.  He used to chase cute little girls in the
messages.messageBody:
>Andy who's 7,.... ...... He has a huge crush on the
>cousin, Sierra, telling us he's going to marry her
>someday -- they'll have 3 little girls for me to
>take care of and she will nurse all the babies of
>course!
....
>His new habit is making sure to smooth his hair when
>we go somewhere, because 'we might see a beautiful
>girl' and he wants to look his best!
>Sylvia

This made me laugh. This is my 7 year old. Ever
since he was a toddler he has been a girl chaser,
literally. He used to chase cute little girls in the
mall or other public places when he was a year or
less. Precocious in more than just walking
apparently! All his best friends, aside from his
brother, have been girls. He is also in love with a
same age cousin, child of my brother. I haven't the
heart to shatter all his inctricate plans by telling
him first cousins don't generally marry. LOL

Nanci K.
